This sketch will include two faces, face\\_1 and face\\_2. Face 1 On face\\_1, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of six lines (line\\_1 through line\\_6). The lines are defined as follows: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1071] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1071], End Point [0.1071, 0.1071] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.1071, 0.1071], End Point [0.1071, 0.2143] * line\\_5: Start Point [0.1071, 0.2143], End Point [0.0, 0.2143] * line\\_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.2143], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Face 2 On face\\_2, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of three lines (line\\_1 through line\\_3) as follows: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.1071, 0.1071], End Point [0.75, 0.1071] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.1071], End Point [0.1071, 0.2143] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.1071, 0.2143], End Point [0.1071, 0.1071] Ensure each loop is closed. Extrusion With the completed sketch, extrude the sketch in the negative direction of the normal (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal = 0.0) with a depth of 0.3214 (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal = 0.3214) using a scaling factor of 0.75 (sketch\\_scale = 0.75). Create a new body (operation = "NewBodyFeatureOperation"). Dimensions The dimensions of the part are as follows: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.3214 * Height: 0.75 Continue with these steps for the remaining parts and follow the instructions given in the CAD Assembly JSON to ensure an accurate CAD model.</description>

The part is complete. The approximated dimensions of this rectangular prism with a centered cylindrical hole would be: - Length: 0.75 units, - Width: 0.045 units, - Height: 0.75 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 0.5 units.</description>
